description: An 8th-century rock-cut temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, carved from a single basalt rock. A serene escape in the heart of Pune.
facts: The temple is a protected monument with intricate carvings depicting Shiva mythology. Locals believe it’s a spiritual hotspot with calming energy.
rules: Photography is allowed, but maintain silence to respect worshippers. Visit early to avoid crowds.

description: A historical fort built in 1732, once the seat of the Peshwas. Known for its grand architecture and eerie legends.
facts: The fort was partially destroyed by a mysterious fire in 1828. Locals claim to hear the screams of Narayanrao Peshwa on full moon nights.
rules: Entry is restricted after 6:30 PM due to paranormal rumors. Avoid visiting alone at night.

description: A picturesque road near Symbiosis College, popular among tourists but eerie at night.
facts: Locals report dogs barking at empty spaces and pedestrians fainting on full moon nights.
rules: Avoid driving or walking alone after midnight. Stick to well-lit areas.

description: A serene artificial lake attracting migratory birds, perfect for nature lovers and photographers.
facts: The lake is a birdwatching hotspot, especially in winter. A peaceful urban escape.
rules: Avoid littering to preserve the ecosystem. Early morning visits are best.

description: A colonial-era bridge with a history of accidents and mysterious deaths.
facts: Locals believe the bridge is haunted by spirits of accident victims. Strange apparitions at night.
rules: Avoid driving across late at night. Chant prayers for safety.

description: Ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves from the 2nd century BC, showcasing remarkable architecture.
facts: The 22 caves include stupas and carvings, less crowded than Karla Caves.
rules: Wear comfortable shoes for the trek. Avoid heavy rains.

description: 1st-century BC Buddhist caves with a grand chaitya hall and intricate carvings.
facts: A UNESCO tentative site with a massive stupa and sculptures.
rules: Entry fees apply. Avoid touching carvings. Visit early.

description: A hill fort with thrilling monsoon treks and panoramic valley views.

description: Landscaped gardens for meditation, part of the Osho International Meditation Resort.

description: Chatrapati Sambhajiraje Garden built by Pune Municipal Corporation flaunts the Aquarium of freshwater ornamental fishes, which was set up on 1st Aug 1952.
facts: The aquarium at the garden is loved by kids as it serves the educational as well as entertainment purpose for them. A garden is a perfect place for children, young as well as for seniors.
rules: Entry during open hours only. Photography for personal use. No pets allowed, unless specified

description: Kamla Nehru Park is situated on Dr. Ketkar Road, Erandwana, Pune. The 10-acre (4.0 ha) park has a jogging track, Playground for kids, a fountain and two lawns.
facts: The park occupies around 10 acres of land in the Erandwane/Deccan Gymkhana area of Pune.
rules: Treat park assets carefully�no damage to plants, benches, fountains, or installations.

description: Vetal Tekdi, also known as Arai Hills, is the highest point in Pune (within the city limits) at an elevation of 2,600 feet. Tekdi means hill in Marathi.
facts: A youth-led weekly musical-jam initiative on Sunday evenings to foster awareness and love for the hill�s natural beauty and biodiversity, doubling as a conservation campaign
rules: Limited early access; better post-5?PM or early morning; travel in groups advised

description: Kundalika Valley is a beautiful natural location in Maharashtra, India, known for its scenic views, lush green landscapes, waterfalls, and adventure sports
facts: The Valley, often called Wandre or Sampiri Valley, is a gorge formed near Tamhini Ghat, roughly 50?km from Pune and 120?km from Mumbai
rules: Entry without proper authorization is strictly prohibited

description: Le Plaisir, located in Pune, is a popular European-style caf� and patisserie known for its elegant ambiance, quality ingredients, and handcrafted dishes.
facts: Offers a European?style caf� vibe with a patisserie counter, warm-toned interiors, lounge seating, and two levels of indoor space seating around 50�60 patrons
rules: Respectful caf� behavior is expected (e.g. no loud partying, proper indoor behavior).

description: Tucked away in a serene bungalow on Lane 5, Koregaon Park, this European?inspired patisserie features a charming blend of outdoor seating amid greenery and cozy indoor corners.
facts: Known for its peaceful ambiance, leafy outdoor seating, art displays, pet-friendly policy, and friendly staff�serving pastries with warmth and attention to detail
rules: General expectation is quiet, respectful dining � the ambiance remains peaceful and not overly noisy

description: Renowned for its iconic Irani caf� experience, Vohuman has been serving the city since the mid-20th century and draws early morning crowds looking for simple, hearty breakfasts
facts: Established on August 15, 1978 by Hormuz Irani, Vohuman Caf� began as a modest Irani-style eatery near Jehangir Hospital and became legendary over decades for its egg-based breakfast staples and Irani chai
rules: Expect swift service, modest seating, minimal conversation, and discouraged gadget use like gaming or working on laptops.

description: It's known for a bright, green, and calm vibe. Opened around 2013, it has become a go-to caf� for both vegans and health-conscious diners
facts: Renowned for its bright interiors, airy layout, and trendy d�cor�ideal for meetings, solo work sessions, or leisure brunching
rules: it's a casual spot where you can just walk in�no advance booking required.

description: It offers book rentals, sales, and a curated selection of independent publishers. The caf� serves organic tea, specialty coffee, homemade cakes, fresh juices, wholesome snacks, and piping hot Adrak Chai
facts: The name Pagdandi (meaning �unpaved path� in Marathi) reflects its ethos�an offbeat, creative space blending a bookstore, caf�, library, and community hub under one roof
rules: The space encourages quiet reading or relaxed conversation, often described as cozy and homely

description: Themed around a metal foundry, the interiors feature exposed brick walls, metal gear installations, Edison-bulb lighting, oil-barrel tables, and vintage industrial d�cor.
facts: Presentation is part of the experience: dishes are served in mason jars, enamel plates, copper mugs, or even pressure-cooker-style containers
rules: Smoking is only permitted in outdoor areas; indoor seating is strictly non-smoking.

description: Designed for readers, with bookshelves stocked with fiction and non-fiction, plus Kindle tablets on every table for free reading
facts: Set in a converted bungalow along F.C. Road, Caf� Kathaa features vibrant interiors, vertical greenery walls, mismatched d�cor, and shaded outdoor seating�perfect for readers and creatives.
rules: Its caf� culture is loosely governed by common courtesy, book caf� etiquette, and space-sharing norms�especially during busy hours.

description: Trendy European?Asian caf� by day, transforming into a lively restaurant-bar at night with themed d�cor inspired by newsprint, a monochrome palette, and botanical touches
facts: Spread across ~4,000?sq?ft with capacity for ~120 guests; divided into indoor and marquee-style outdoor seating with hanging bulb d�cor and greenery
rules: Smoking or vaping indoors is prohibited by law and the venue enforces this strictly.

description: This caf� is tucked amidst greenery and offers serene open-air seating under trees�ideal for a peaceful breakfast or brunch.
facts: A health-focused caf� tucked inside a quiet lane near German Bakery, Yogi Tree offers a peaceful, leafy ambiance ideal for brunch or light conversation. It�s known for its open-air greenery-lined seating and wholesome menu.
rules: Pets are welcome in the outdoor seating area only. Smoking (tobacco) is allowed in designated outdoor areas only

description: Waari Book Cafe is a serene and creatively-charged space in Kothrud�perfect for bibliophiles, solo workers, and cozy leisure
facts: Blending an extensive book collection, inviting ambiance, simple grub, and community events, it�s a standout in Pune�s caf� culture.
rules: A cover charge of ?60 per person allows up to two hours of stay. This entry fee is redeemable against beverages or food purchases.
